newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Town renames school in Belgian child sex scandal.
newsitem.headline: Town renames school in Belgian child sex scandal.

text.p: A Belgian school is changing its name to honour two former pupils slain by a child-sex gang, media reports said on Wednesday.
The Crotteux Communal School in Grace-Hollogne near Liege is to be renamed the Julie and Melissa School, La Derniere Heure newspaper reported.
Eight-year-olds Julie Lejeune and Melissa Russo were found dead on August 17 on a property owned by convicted child rapist Marc Dutroux.
"We wanted to pay homage to the two little girls," the newspaper quoted Mayor Maurice Mottard as saying.

Four young girls have died as captives of a paedophile porn ring alleged to have been run by Dutroux in a scandal that has shocked the nation and prompted calls for international action against vice trafficking in youngsters.
Two others were rescued from a cramped secret dungeon in a house owned by Dutroux, who was also involved in car theft.
Police, searching for at least seven other girls -- some missing for years -- on Tuesday made their 12th arrest in the case.

Dutroux, who has previously been charged only with abduction and illegal imprisonment, was also formally charged with the murder of Frenchman Bernard Weinstein -- an accomplice whom he admits killing.
Different police forces are currently engaged in a public slanging match with each other and the judicial authorities over who made the most mistakes in the bungled investigations.

Dutroux' own mother -- with whom he has not been on talking terms for more than 20 years -- denounced him to police as a criminal last year in an attempt to regain possession of her house from him. Police took no action.

Belgium has been in shock since the bodies of Julie and Melissa were found on a property owned by unemployed father of three Dutroux near the southern city of Charleroi. Weinstein's body was unearthed in the same spot.
The two children had been kidnapped by associates of Dutroux in June 1995. He said they starved to death early this year.

The discovery followed the rescue of two other girls -- Laetitia Delhez, 14, and Sabine Dardenne, 12, -- from the secret dungeon in another house owned by Dutroux in Marcinelle, a suburb of Charleroi.
Two more teenagers -- Eefje Lambrecks and An Marchal -- were found dead two and a half weeks later at the home of Weinstein.
